1069671709253324800.text: We negotiate with stakeholders so that our need for boundaries (in order to get the work done) and our responsibilities to the community can be balanced.

1069671295137198080.text: Privacy involves respecting each others' boundaries. We may wish to work on impactful projects with others of our choosing, and to do so behind closed doors, but this can violate our responsibility to stakeholders that are potentially impacted.

1069670895327698946.text: When people are affected by our work, we carry a responsibility for that. Openness is respecting the stakeholders who may be affected, providing them insight into the process, and incorporating their concerns.

1069670735218495488.text: Privacy and openness are not in contradiction; they interact with each other and are negotiated by stakeholders.https://twitter.com/lrettig/status/1069601042952790016 …

This is the closest Facebook came to defining its "values", as described by the leadership in 2012:

Focus on Impact.
Move Fast.
Be Bold. 
Be Open.
Build Social Value.

Corporate bullshit aiming at growth, not values which would safely guide an agglomeration of 2B people.

1063971800273453057.text: Facebook is haunted by its original bland mandate: "making the world more open and connected". This is far too neutral; where is the "how"? Facebook's failures tell the Ethereum community that we must find our values and address the issues of governance in our various realms.

1063956757272178688.text: As fun as it is to grandstand, security is more of a spectrum than the pregnancy analogy implies. Still, we routinely approach a threshold at which we have dangerously degraded the benefit of Ethereum's security properties because we depend on traditional infrastructure.

1063954615371128832.text: The Ethereum community will "d" the apps, and ASAP. Like pregnancy, you can't be half secure. Ethereum is amazing tech, why would we ask users to use it through insecure infrastructure? The pieces to create a "d" stack include @ensdomains, @ethswarm, whisper.

1063953757908529152.text: Dapps are part of the web3 vision, first articulated in April, 2014 by Gavin Wood and expanded on by @TaylorGerring. The web3 was conceptualized after proof emerged that the cloud infrastructure that web and mobile apps depend on was routinely compromised.

1063951293310369792.text: That "d" in dapp isn't some fancy marketing. It doesn't refer to Ethereum either (it would be "e" if that were the case). The "d" in dapp means that we want to decentralize every part of applications which interact with Ethereum.

1058258196513443840.text: The Ethereum Magicians emerged from an idea that the practices of social activism and from commons resource management groups like the IETF can be applied to Ethereum.

1058258022575685632.text: Ethereum seems to be a system which can potentially help us manage resources while offsetting the problems of power. But the protocol itself, and all of its pieces, requires resource management.

1058257966007115776.text: Power is what "capture" is trying to capture. And human beings tend to work very hard to socially coordinate so that resources are managed coherently, and mitigating the agglomeration (with varying results).

1058254093318156288.text: Power attracts. Power agglomerates. Power corrupts.

1058253908697526272.text: Participants in resource management also have to deal with a very dangerous side-effect: power.pic.twitter.com/inOtJZEDi2

1058253492752572416.text: It is wonderful that we are able to step forward and take responsibility for resources, to gather people together in order to manage them. But when we govern we have to manage the tradeoffs between efficiency, openness, and quality.

1058250823640072192.text: I gave a presentation with @greg_colvin and @bmann about how the @EthMagicians began to form. From my perspective, the motive behind "disorganizing" the Ethereum Magicians is rooted in the challenges of managing a common good resource. A.K.A. governance.

1054304797787009024.text: The institutions in our community are all about beating the drum for the love of civic participation, maybe they run some events too . But it is different than hype, because of the intentions behind the advocacy. I wish I were at #Web3Summit to see it in action today.
